description:
We need relationships.

The need for company is one of the most important and basic needs of human beings.

Beyond a limit , solitude turns painful.

Evidence suggests that an absence of satisfying relationships can undermine the life force itself.

Lack of close companionship and communication could cause a number of health disorders.

Conflict is a normal part of any healthy relationship.

After all, two people can't be expected to agree on everything, all the time.

Resolving Conflicts With Spouse:

A marriage, millions of people dream of the day they will get married. But do they dream of the conflict that might come with that marriage? Absolutely not. Take this course as a simple guide to how to resolve the conflict that comes with marriage.

Resolving Family Conflict:

Conflict is inevitable among families, and the ways families choose to resolve conflict makes a huge difference. Families who peacefully resolve conflict may grow closer as they learn from one another and work hard to take one another's feelings into consideration. When conflict remains unresolved, however, it may lead to family members harboring anger, growing resentful and trying to force other family members to take sides.

Learning how to deal with conflict—rather than avoiding it—is crucial. When conflict is mismanaged, it can cause great harm to a relationship, but when handled in a respectful, positive way, conflict provides an opportunity to strengthen the bond between two people

The present course 'How To Save Your Relationship" helps you in:

  • resolving conflicts with your spouse by providing several important tips.
  • resolving conflicts with critics.
  • managing conflicts with parents or brothers or sisters or children by providing three different solutions
  • improving your interpersonal relationship.

The present course "How To Save Your Relationship " explains how a relationship develops.

The present course will also helps you in improving your communication behaviour.
title: Conflict Resolution: How To Resolve Family Conflict
